Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced students at Level 4 demonstrate a complete and accurate representation of all required elements in the task.
CAN: Draw two distinct habitats, one land-based and one aquatic, with clear distinctions between the environments.

Include a variety of living things in both habitats. For example, showing mammals, birds, insects, and various plants in the land habitat, and fish, aquatic plants, and other aquatic life in the water habitat.
Provide specific examples in the land habitat like oak trees, squirrels, robins, daisies, and wildflowers to illustrate biodiversity.
Depict specific aquatic life in the water habitat such as trout, water lilies, frogs, clams, and algae, highlighting diverse ecosystems.
Show patterns in the type of living things found in each habitat, making clear distinctions in biodiversity with accurate labeling and positioning.
CANNOT: May occasionally forget to label some of the living things or misplace a label due to minor oversight.
Might attempt to illustrate a rare or advanced concept (e.g., symbiotic relationships) but with varied success, potentially missing some details.
